Many cases of illegal oil transportation

Despite warnings that they would face
legal measures, hundreds of Korean intern doctors
simultaneously filed applications.  leave Vietnam and
will stop working from February 20.
This move is to protest the government's
sharp increase in medical school enrollment, thereby raising
concerns about the risk of a
medical crisis in the East
Asian country with hundreds of doctors.  Korean interns
mass strike led to a series of
surgeons being detained or demonized at
major hospitals on the same day Korean Deputy Health Minister
Park Minsu confirmed that nearly 6,500
out of 13,000 doctors and
interns in  Major hospitals have applied for
resignations,
meaning nearly half of the workforce of
about 1,630 people have
officially retired. He called on
interns not to turn away patients. The
government will implement a new system.
emergency response system to minimize
disruption of medical services. In
addition, the government will also send people to check
hospitals to see if doctors are on
strike or not in response to the example of
Vietnamese President Joh Cho.  Knowing that the
government will not back down from
necessary reforms, saying that this is an
essential measure to prepare for a rapidly aging population,
